title: How Kerala eradicated extreme poverty

Four lakh enumerators fanned out across the State and identified the most marginalised. The local bodies then devised micro-plans to suit each family. The government claims that the programme uplifted 1,03,099 people from extreme poverty. S.R. Praveen interacts with some of the beneficiaries and also listens to dissenting voices

title: US Deported 2,790 Indians Staying Illegally: Centre

content: A massive police raid targeting a drug-trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro left at least 121 people dead, authorities said Thursday morning.

title: Pentagon's DOGE Unit Spearheads US Military Drone Overhaul
content: The Pentagon's DOGE unit is leading efforts to overhaul the US military drone program, including streamlining procurement, expanding homegrown production, and acquiring tens of thousands of cheap drones in the coming months.

content: A man who kept 19 people including 17 children hostage in a Mumbai studio on Thursday was shot dead by a policeman just as the gunman was about to aim at one of the hostages, sources said.

title: Trump Has More Energy Than Someone 40 Years Younger: JD Vance
content: US Vice President JD Vance acknowledged that President Donald Trump has "unbelievable energy" and more than someone that is 40 years younger.

title: Amid Stalled Afghan-Pak Talks, India Says Committed To Kabul's Sovereignty
content: India threw its weight behind Afghanistan in the face of its border conflict with Pakistan and said Islamabad's efforts to "practice" cross-border terrorism with "impunity" is unacceptable to its neighbours.

title: Bengaluru Techie Orders Rs 1.87-Lakh Smartphone, Gets A Tile Instead
content: A Bengaluru-based software engineer fell victim to a delivery scam after receiving a piece of tile instead of a Rs 1.87 Lakh Samsung smartphone he had ordered through online shopping platform Amazon.

title: 'Drop In The Ocean': UN Says 24,000 Tonnes Of Aid Reached Gaza Since Truce
content: More than 24,000 tons of UN aid has reached Gaza since the start of a ceasefire earlier this month, a UN official said on Thursday while calling for NGOs to be allowed to assist in its distribution.

title: Chandigarh Bans 6 Aggressive Dog Breeds Including Pitbull, Rottweiler
content: The Municipal Corporation of Chandigarh has banned six aggressive dog breeds, including American Bulldog, American Pitbull and Bull Terrier, for public safety, as it notified the Pet and Community Dogs Bye-laws.

title: Land Rising In Delhi's Dwarka, Points To Groundwater Bouncing Back: ISRO-IIT study
content: For years, the ground beneath southwest Delhi quietly sank as its aquifers ran dry. Now, satellites show a rare reversal; the land in Dwarka is rising again, a sign that the city's long-depleted groundwater is slowly bouncing back, a study claimed.

title: Hundreds Killed As Last Functioning Hospital In Sudan's Al-Fashir Attacked
content: The last functioning hospital in the Sudanese city of al-Fashir was raided, and hundreds are feared to have been killed there after a paramilitary force overran the city this week, the World Health Organisation and a Sudanese official said.

title: Indian Firms Get Licenses To Import Rare Earth Magnets From China
content: Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that some Indian companies have received licenses for importing rare earth magnets from China.

title: 5-Month-Old Dies After Being Given Medicines, Including Herbal Cough Syrup In Madhya Pradesh
content: Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district, already under national scrutiny after the deaths of at least 20 children due to contaminated cough syrup-induced acute kidney failure, has been shaken again by another tragedy.

title: 'Goodbye, Once Again': Israeli Mother Buries Hostage Son For Third Time
content: The family of Ofir Tzarfati, a young Israeli who was seized from a music festival, taken to Gaza and killed, was caught between grief and fury on Thursday as they buried their son for the third time.

title: Dream Big, Aim Higher: Shubhanshu Shukla To Model Rocketry Competition Participants
content: India's model rocketry and CANSAT competition saw enthusiastic participation from over 600 students with astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla exhorting them to dream big and aim higher.

title: Mohammad Azharuddin To Be Sworn In As Minister In Telangana On Friday
content: Former Indian cricket captain and senior Congress leader Mohammad Azharuddin is set to be sworn in as a minister in the Telangana cabinet on Friday.

title: 'This Will Cost You Dearly': Taliban Minister Slams Pak For Border Turmoil
content: In a sharp escalation of diplomatic faceoff following weeks of deadly border clashes and failed peace negotiations, Afghanistan's Interior Minister, Sirajuddin Haqqani, has issued a scathing rebuke of Pakistan.

title: 'Among Brightest And Best': Envoy Praises 1.7 Lakh Indian Students Across UK
content: At a special welcome event for Indian students in the UK, Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami celebrated their growing presence and impact on the country's academic and cultural landscape.

title: Women‚Äôs WC: Jemimah scripts history; IND pull off biggest WODI chase to enter final
content: Jemimah Rodrigues' career-defining 127 not out powered India to a stunning five-wicket victory over Australia in the Women's ODI World Cup semifinal. Chasing a massive 339, India's improbable chase was anchored by Rodrigues' magnificent century, guiding them to their maiden World Cup final against South Africa. This historic win marks a monumental achievement for Indian women's cricket.

title: Mumbai hostage scare: What Rohit Arya said in chilling video ‚Äî his demands & motive revealed
content: A tense hostage situation in Mumbai's Powai concluded with police shooting Rohit Arya, who held 17 children and two adults captive. Arya, claiming he only wanted a conversation, was shot after allegedly attempting to harm the children with an air gun. He later died in hospital. Police successfully rescued all hostages.

title: ‚ÄòLast 4 months have been really hard‚Äô: Jemimah breaks down after win
content: Jemimah Rodrigues delivered a match-winning unbeaten 127, guiding India to a record ODI chase of 339 against Australia. This victory secured India's spot in the Women's World Cup final. Rodrigues expressed deep gratitude for her faith and support system. The team's remarkable performance overcame a challenging situation, setting up a historic win.

title: Google AI Pro plan worth Rs 35,100 free for Reliance Jio users: these users to get priority access
content: Reliance Industries and Google are joining forces. Eligible Jio users will receive 18 months of free Google AI Pro. This initiative aims to make artificial intelligence accessible to everyone in India. Young Jio 5G users aged 18 to 25 will be the first to benefit. The partnership also extends to enterprise AI solutions, empowering Indian businesses with advanced AI tools and infrastructure.

title: Rs 8 lakh cash deposited in bank - man gets tax notice! How he won case in ITAT
content: A taxpayer successfully challenged the tax department's decision to treat a large cash deposit as presumptive business income. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled that the Assessing Officer exceeded his jurisdiction by expanding a limited scrutiny case without proper approval, reinforcing taxpayer rights.

title: 'Regime change op': Delhi Police's big charge in 2020 riots case; argues in SC for 'jail, not bail'
content: Delhi Police told the Supreme Court that activists Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and others allegedly conspired for a "regime change operation" during the 2020 riots.  The police claimed evidence shows a deep-rooted plan to destabilize the nation, aiming for armed rebellion and international attention during Donald Trump's visit, warranting jail, not bail.

title: Critical technologies are being used as 'weapons' in global trade: HCL co-founder
content: HCL co-founder Ajai Chowdhry proposes recycling e-waste to meet India's rare-earth mineral demand, suggesting this can fulfill 30-40% of domestic needs. This faster alternative to mining, which takes five to seven years, addresses the strategic risk posed by China's dominance in rare earth supply, crucial for technologies like EVs and batteries.

title: 3I ATLAS detected sending Fibonacci pulse signal at 1420 MHz
content: Scientists are investigating a mysterious pulse signal from interstellar object 3I/ATLAS. The signal reportedly follows a Fibonacci pattern and is detected at a frequency linked to interstellar communication. Researchers are cautiously exploring the possibility of an intelligent transmission. This discovery has sparked global curiosity about extraterrestrial life and potential signals from space.

title: Controversy! Mandhana‚Äôs DRS dismissal triggers drama ‚Äî Watch
content: India's Smriti Mandhana was controversially dismissed for 24 in the World Cup semi-final against Australia. A late DRS review, initiated with seconds to spare, showed a spike on UltraEdge despite Mandhana's clear belief of no contact. This crucial wicket, at a critical juncture of the challenging chase, significantly impacted India's momentum.

title: Inside Mumbai hostage scare: How cops stormed studio; what was accused's motive?
content: Young actor aspirants were held hostage at a Mumbai studio by a self-proclaimed filmmaker demanding to speak to certain individuals. Police successfully stormed the studio, rescuing 19 hostages, including 17 children, and apprehending the suspect. The motive is believed to be work-related dues, with the suspect appearing mentally unstable.

title: AI‚Äôs next victim? Expert predicts Salesforce collapse; sparks debate
content: A prominent computer science professor predicts Salesforce will be the first major tech company disrupted by AI, sparking widespread debate. Experts argue AI's superior data handling capabilities and tailored solutions threaten traditional CRM models.

title: Former national tennis champion banned for two years; morphine found in dope test
content: Former national champion Dalwinder Singh has been banned for two years by the International Tennis Integrity Agency after testing positive for morphine. The 29-year-old admitted to the violation, attributing the substance to pain medication following wrist surgery. However, he failed to provide supporting evidence, leading to the suspension and forfeiture of his results.

title: 'Can't break deal': Pak says 'US drones behind Afghan strikes'; makes shocking admission
content: Pakistan has admitted to a US drone agreement during Pakistan-Afghanistan peace talks, causing Afghan negotiators to demand written guarantees against drone use in their airspace. The talks collapsed as Pakistan blamed Kabul for refusing to act against militants, with Islamabad vowing to protect its people from terrorism.

title: Lamar Jackson set to play vs Dolphins tonight: Latest Ravens injury update
content: Lamar Jackson is set to return for the Baltimore Ravens tonight against the Miami Dolphins, a significant boost for the team's playoff hopes. After a three-game absence due to a hamstring injury, the star quarterback is confirmed to start. His dual-threat capabilities, combined with Derrick Henry, are expected to exploit a vulnerable Dolphins defense, potentially igniting Baltimore's season.

title: Stefon Diggs linked to Drake‚Äôs ‚ÄòKiki‚Äô pregnancy while expecting with Cardi B
content: A shocking rumour has emerged concerning NFL star Stefon Diggs.  While Cardi B is confirmed to be pregnant with his child, DJ Akademiks alleges Diggs also got K'yanna Barber pregnant. Barber is famously known as 'Kiki' from Drake's hit song 'In My Feelings'. This news has sparked widespread online discussion and memes.

title: Tua Tagovailoa set to play vs Ravens tonight: Latest Dolphins injury update
content: Despite a slow start to the season, the Miami Dolphins are set to face the Baltimore Ravens tonight. Quarterback Tua Tagovailoa, nursing a thumb and eye injury, is confirmed to play. He practiced fully and expressed improved vision, though he may wear a visor. The game kicks off at 8:15 PM ET at Hard Rock Stadium.

title: Golden State Warriors vs Milwaukee Bucks injury report: who‚Äôs in, who‚Äôs out
content: The Golden State Warriors face the Milwaukee Bucks in a highly anticipated early-season clash. Despite some injuries, both teams boast championship talent. Stephen Curry and Jimmy Butler are healthy for the Warriors, while Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for the Bucks. Expect a tactical battle with key matchups defining the outcome.

title: Gabrielle Union tears up as Kaavia shares heartfelt message on her 53rd birthday
content: Gabrielle Union, celebrating her 53rd birthday while filming in Rome, was deeply moved by a touching throwback Instagram post from her daughter Kaavia. The heartfelt message, shared by Kaavia, brought Gabrielle to tears, highlighting the enduring power of love despite distance. Gabrielle Union is currently filming for her upcoming project in Rome.

title: Racy clips & blackmail: Inside cold-blooded 'live-in murders'; what's pushing partners to kill?
content: Once a symbol of freedom, live-in relationships in India are now linked to chilling incidents of betrayal, violence, and death. From brutal murders to gruesome dismemberment, recent cases highlight a disturbing trend where possessiveness and jealousy escalate into extreme violence, challenging societal norms and legal interpretations.

title: Bihar polls: BJP complains to EC over Rahul's dancer remark; Cong doubles down
content: The Congress has hit back at the BJP's complaint against Rahul Gandhi's "dance" remark targeting PM Modi. Congress leader Pawan Khera accused the BJP of being "issueless" and lacking a vision for the Bihar elections. He questioned the BJP's right to object to "dance" when their prime minister has used words like 'mujhra'.

title: US curbs on Russian crude: Will India & China stop buying? Why it's highly unlikely
content: US sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil are unlikely to halt Indian and Chinese crude purchases, though short-term disruptions are anticipated. While buyers reassess risk, direct purchases by non-US entities remain legally permissible, suggesting major export disruptions are improbable.

title: No Magnus Carlsen! D Gukesh to headline 2026 Masters lineup at 'Wimbledon of Chess'
content: The 88th Tata Steel Chess Tournament in Wijk aan Zee, from January 16 to February 1, 2026, boasts its youngest-ever lineup with an average age of 23. Featuring four top-10 and ten top-30 players, the event promises a dynamic battle for the title. This prestigious tournament continues to solidify Wijk aan Zee as a global chess hub.

title: Usha's Hindu faith helped JD find Christ again - what changed?
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãFor years, JD Vance sounded almost liberal about it ‚Äî the man who once mocked religion in his twenties had become the poster boy for spiritual humility. He talked about her vegetarian cooking, her moral steadiness, her influence on his faith. ‚ÄúShe encouraged me to reconnect with God,‚Äù he told friends and reporters.

title: Men call AI, data analytics masculine; gendered meritocracy exists; equality feels hollow
content: In a world that claims progress, bias has merely changed its form. A new Capgemini Research Institute report reveals that while women match men in confidence and capability, nearly half of male leaders still label AI and innovation skills as ‚Äúmasculine.‚Äù The patriarchy, it seems, has not vanished‚Äîit has simply learned to code.

title: Brother wins SC case over father‚Äôs house sale despite no will share
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that only a registered sale deed can transfer property ownership, not an unproven Will or GPA. This decision settled a decades-old family dispute, clarifying that informal documents cannot confer title. The court emphasized that a sale is valid only for the seller's lawful share, protecting other heirs' rights.

title: Justice Surya Kant appointed as 53rd CJI; oath on Nov 24
content: Justice Surya Kant has been appointed as the 53rd Chief Justice of India. He will formally take oath on November 24, succeeding Chief Justice Bhushan Gavai, and will become the first top justice from Haryana.

title: CBSE Board Exam 2026: Dates announced; check full schedule
content: CBSE has released the final schedule for Class 10 and 12 board examinations 2026, starting February 17, 2026, at 10:30 AM (IST). The tentative schedule was earlier released on September 24, 2025. The final date sheet considers student subject combinations, entrance exam dates, and teacher availability, ensuring no clashes. Students, teachers, and schools can now plan preparations, evaluations, and logistics in advance. The complete timetable is available for download on the official CBSE website.

title: 'US behind China but will catch up': Bessent after Trump orders nuclear weapons testing
content: President Trump ordered the immediate resumption of nuclear weapons testing, ending a 33-year moratorium, citing China's advancements. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended the move as crucial for America to "catch up" with China's nuclear power development. The announcement preceded high-stakes trade talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Forgetfulness to fatigue: 6 early warning signs of accelerated brain aging
content: Forgetfulness and fatigue might signal accelerated brain aging, not just stress. Subtle shifts in energy, inflammation, and sleep patterns can impact neuron communication. Identifying early signs like mental fatigue, word recall issues, poor sleep, irritability, sensory hypersensitivity, and post-meal brain fog is crucial. Lifestyle and metabolic factors can help slow this process.

title: Vanessa Bryant‚Äôs family outing steals spotlight as Dodgers fall to Blue Jays
content: Vanessa Bryant and her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri were present at the Rogers Center for Game 5 of the 2025 World Series Championship, supporting the Los Angeles Dodgers against the Toronto Blue Jays. Despite the Dodgers' tough loss, the Bryant family's presence brought a bright spot to the stadium. They are devoted Dodgers fans, continuing Kobe Bryant's legacy.

title: Mumbai hostage crisis ends: Kidnapper dies of bullet injuries, had shot at cops; 19 rescued
content: A man, identified as Rohit Arya, took 19 people, including 17 children, hostage in a Mumbai flat on Thursday. Arya died in a police crossfire after threatening to harm himself and the children. All children were safely rescued, and police suspect work-related dues as the motive.

title: 'Already a subject of public ridicule': Red Chillies on Wankhede‚Äôs defamation suit
content: Red Chillies Entertainment argues that IRS officer Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against its Netflix series "The Bads of Bollywood" is "misconceived." The production house stated the show is situational satire, does not name Wankhede, and that his reputation was already damaged by a CBI FIR prior to its release.

title: IPL: Abhishek Nayar named KKR head coach; replaces Chandrakant Pandit
content: Abhishek Nayar has been appointed as the new head coach of Kolkata Knight Riders, succeeding Chandrakant Pandit. Nayar, a long-standing member of the KKR setup since 2018, brings progressive coaching methods and a player-centric philosophy to the role. He will work alongside mentor Dwayne Bravo as KKR embarks on its next phase.

title: TTP dy chief dead: Amjad killed in cross-border fire; Pak PM hails troops
content: Pakistan's security forces killed Amjad, the TTP's second-in-command and a high-value target, along with three other militants during an foiled infiltration attempt from Afghanistan into Bajaur district. President Zardari and Prime Minister Sharif lauded the operation, emphasising Pakistan's commitment to defeating elements harming innocent people.

title: Chess boom continues! 16-year-old Ilamparthi AR becomes India‚Äôs 90th Grandmaster
content: Chennai's 16-year-old Ilamparthi AR has become India's 90th Grandmaster, achieving his final norm at the Bijeljina Open. He previously secured norms in Vietnam and Singapore, crossing the 2500 Elo mark. Nurtured by Velammal School and supported by initiatives, Ilamparthi trains under Viswanathan Anand's academy.

title: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson‚Äôs longtime girlfriend stays low-key as he fights injury
content: Lamar Jackson, the Baltimore Ravens' two-time MVP quarterback, maintains a private personal life with his long-term girlfriend, Jaime Taylor, whom he met in high school. The couple, who share a daughter named Milan, prioritize privacy amidst Jackson's high-profile NFL career. Taylor has spoken about learning resilience from Jackson's approach to criticism and external noise.

title: Bihar polls: Owaisi raises Muslim leadership demand; will it dent MGB's prospects?
content: Speaking at an election rally in Kishanganj on Wednesday, Owaisi referred to VIP chief Vikas Sahani and said that if a leader from the Malla community can be projected for the deputy chief minister's post, then a leader from the Muslim community can also aim for the positions of Chief Minister and even Prime Minister.

title: ‚ÄòMain kyu gaali khaun‚Äô: Nitin Gadkari orders QR codes on highway sites
content: The road transport ministry is leveraging social media for highway project transparency. NHAI and builders will now upload construction videos on YouTube for public feedback. QR codes on national highways will display contractor and official details, ensuring accountability for road quality. This initiative aims to enhance public participation and deliver international-standard roads.

title: Financial rules shake-up in Nov: From bank deposits to pension deadlines ‚Äî details
content: New banking regulations starting November 1, 2025, will allow up to four nominees for bank accounts and safety lockers. SBI Card is also updating its fee structure for education payments and wallet reloads. Additionally, PNB is reducing locker rent, and government pensioners have extended deadlines for life certificate submissions and NPS transitions.

title: Big diplomatic win: India gets 6-month waiver from US sanctions on Chabahar port
content: The US has granted India a six-month exemption from sanctions on the Chabahar port, a significant diplomatic achievement amidst ongoing trade deal negotiations. This development allows India to continue its investments and strategic access to Afghanistan and Central Asia. India is also analysing the implications of US sanctions on Russian oil companies, prioritising energy security for its population.

title: Packers' 1923 throwbacks, Commanders' 'Super Bowl era' threads top Week 9 uniforms
content: the Packers and Washington Commanders are the latest teams to debut throwback threads . the threads include a brown, hand-painted helmet meant to emulate the vintage leather look of the league's earliest helmets. the navy blue jerseys are designed with dark gold numbers and stripes on the shoulder, with tan pants .

title: How Trey Yesavage met the moment and pushed the Dodgers to the brink
content: Trey Yesavage hits out 12 in a showtopping performance for the blue Jays vs. the Dodgers . the 22-year-old right-handed rookie was under attack during game 5 of the world series . his first game this season came in April for Single-A Dunedin .

title: Ranking the top 50 NHL prospects: Who follows Schaefer, Demidov?
content: the Islanders lead the list with five in my top 50, followed by the blackhawks, sharks and mammoth with four apiece . no. 1 draft pick Matthew Schaefer is the only defenseman in NHL history to record a point in his first five games .

title: Pushed to the periphery, Nwaneri seizes his chance to shine for Arsenal
content: Ethan Nwaneri is still only 18 and has had to wait for a moment like this . the 18-year-old was one of arsenal's breakthrough stars of last season . but fortunes have conspired to complicate his continued involvement in the first team .

title: Edgecombe overtakes Flagg as ROY favorite; what it means for betting, fantasy
content: VJ Edgecombe ( +110 ) has officially surpassed Cooper Flagg ( +115 ) as the favorite to win the NBA's Rookie of the Year, according to ESPN BET . he is off to an amazing start, averaging 22.3 PPG, 5.8 RPG, 5.5 APG, 3.0 3PG and 1.5 SPG through his first four games while helping the Philadelphia 76ers to a surprising 4-0 start .

title: What Aidan Hutchinson's extension means, and which pass rushers are getting paid next
content: aidan Hutchinson has been a star for the team from day one . he finished second in the 2022 draft with a team-leading 9.5 sacks and a pro Bowl nod . the move means the franchise will have its best pass rusher for years to come .

content: the player rankings update helped classes at Texas Tech, Indiana and Minnesota climb . the bigger picture to watch is how the slew of current and potential job openings will impact the class rankings . classes at Florida and LSU bring a great deal of intrigue as they are ranked inside the top 15 .

title: What to expect at the trade deadline for every team: Perfect fits, candidates to move, more

title: India comes out in support of Afganistan plan to dam Pakistan-bound river
content: the govt reiterated its position that it is fully committed to the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Afghanistan . there's a history of cooperation between India and Afghanistan on such issues, including the Salma Dam in Herat province .
